questions.question: What is the significance of the average waiting time in evaluating the performance of a GI/M/c/N queueing system?

answers.a: It measures the average time a customer spends in the queue.
answers.b: It represents the maximum waiting time experienced by any customer in the system.
answers.c: It indicates the average time a server spends idle between serving customers.
answers.d: It measures the variability in waiting times across different customers in the system.

explanations.a: Correct. The average waiting time reflects the overall time customers spend in the queue, before entering into the service.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The average waiting time focuses on the average rather than the maximum waiting time.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The average waiting time is not related to the idle time of servers.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The average waiting time does not measure variability but rather the average duration of waiting.

questions.question: Why is the utilization of servers an essential performance measure in a GI/M/c/N queueing system?

answers.a: High server utilization ensures shorter waiting times for customers.
answers.b: Server utilization directly correlates with system stability.
answers.c: Low server utilization indicates efficient use of resources.
answers.d: Server utilization reflects the fraction of time servers are busy serving customers.

explanations.a: Incorrect. High server utilization may lead to longer waiting times if the system becomes congested.
explanations.b: Incorrect. While server utilization impacts system performance, it does not directly correlate with system stability.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Low server utilization may indicate underutilization of resources rather than efficiency.
explanations.d: Correct. Server utilization measures the fraction of time servers are busy serving customers, making it essential for assessing resource efficiency and system performance.

questions.question: What does the queue length represent as a performance measure in a GI/M/c/N queueing system?

answers.a: The average number of customers in the system waiting to be served.
answers.b: The maximum number of customers the system can accommodate simultaneously.
answers.c: The variability in waiting times experienced by different customers.
answers.d: The fraction of time servers are busy serving customers.

explanations.a: Correct. The queue length indicates the average number of customers waiting in line to be served, providing insights into system congestion and performance.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The queue length refers to the number of customers waiting in line, not the maximum capacity of the system.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The queue length measures the number of customers waiting, not the variability in waiting times.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Server utilization, not the queue length, reflects the fraction of time servers are busy serving customers.

questions.question: Why is the system throughput considered a critical performance measure in the GI/M/c/N queueing system?

answers.a: It measures the average service time experienced by customers in the system.
answers.b: System throughput directly correlates with server utilization.
answers.c: High system throughput ensures efficient resource utilization and customer service.
answers.d: System throughput indicates the maximum number of customers the system can serve simultaneously.

explanations.a: Incorrect. System throughput measures the rate at which the system processes customers, not their individual service times.
explanations.b: Incorrect. While system throughput and server utilization are related, they are distinct performance measures.
explanations.c: Correct. System throughput reflects the rate at which the system processes customers, providing insights into resource utilization and overall system efficiency.
explanations.d: Incorrect. System throughput measures the rate of customer processing, not the maximum system capacity.
